intro: Logania ciliolata, commonly known as the silky logania, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
